meanings.definition: A person or thing that reminds or prompts someone to remember something.
meanings.sent1: The old photo album acted as a remembrancers, bringing back memories of our childhood.
meanings.sent2: The gentle sound of the wind chimes served as a pleasant remembrancers of the peaceful garden.
meanings.sent3: The sticky note on the fridge was a helpful remembrancers to buy milk on the way home.
meanings.sent4: Her favorite song became a powerful remembrancers of the summer they spent together.
meanings.sent5: The scent of freshly baked cookies was a delightful remembrancers of grandma's kitchen.

meanings.definition: An official or legal document that serves as a reminder or record of a debt or obligation.
meanings.sent1: The receipt from the store acted as a remembrancers of the items purchased.
meanings.sent2: The contract served as a crucial remembrancers of the terms agreed upon by both parties.
meanings.sent3: The parking ticket was an unwelcome remembrancers of the time limit in the parking lot.
meanings.sent4: The invoice was a clear remembrancers of the amount owed for the services provided.
meanings.sent5: The loan agreement was a formal remembrancers of the borrowed amount and repayment schedule.
